articles.headline: F.D.A. to Examine Menthol Cigarettes
articles.snippet: Critics of smoking say the flavoring was used as a lure for young people while also being marketed to black smokers.
articles.abstract: Critics of smoking say the flavoring was used as a lure for young people while also being marketed to black smokers.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the cigarette industry, the menthol debate is about to flare up again.

articles.headline: Judge Invalidates Human Gene Patent
articles.snippet: In a ruling with potentially far-reaching implications for the patenting of human genes, a judge struck down a company’s patents on two genes linked to an increased risk of breast and ovarian cancer.
articles.abstract: In a ruling with potentially far-reaching implications for the patenting of human genes, a judge struck down a company’s patents on two genes linked to an increased risk of breast and ovarian cancer.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Monday struck down patents on two genes linked to breast and ovarian cancer. The decision, if upheld, could throw into doubt the patents covering thousands of human genes and reshape the law of intellectual property
articles.byline: By John Schwartz and Andrew Pollack

articles.headline: CNN Fails to Stop Fall in Ratings
articles.snippet: Even the network’s biggest evening stars were being pounded by competitors, especially those at Fox News.
articles.abstract: Even the network’s biggest evening stars were being pounded by competitors, especially those at Fox News.
articles.lead_paragraph: CNN continued what has become a precipitous decline in ratings for its prime-time programs in the first quarter of 2010, with its main hosts losing almost half their viewers in a year.

articles.headline: Companies Push to Repeal Provision of Health Law
articles.snippet: An association representing 300 large companies said a provision of the health overhaul would hurt profits.
articles.abstract: An association representing 300 large companies said a provision of the health overhaul would hurt profits.
articles.lead_paragraph: An association representing 300 large corporations urged President Obama and Congress on Monday to repeal a provision of the health care overhaul that prompted AT&T, Caterpillar and other companies to announce substantial charges for the current quarter.

articles.headline: Spurt of Home Buying as End of Tax Credit Looms
articles.snippet: After several disastrous months for home sales, the pace appears to be picking up again.
articles.abstract: After several disastrous months for home sales, the pace appears to be picking up again.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — Nine hundred days after putting their house on the market, Andrew and Jane Palestini were beginning to think they might be stuck in Iowa forever.

articles.headline: State Debt Woes Grow Too Big to Camouflage
articles.snippet: High debt levels are causing states to take desperate measures to make their finances appear healthy.
articles.abstract: High debt levels are causing states to take desperate measures to make their finances appear healthy.
articles.lead_paragraph: California, New York and other states are showing many of the same signs of debt overload that recently took Greece to the brink — budgets that will not balance, accounting that masks debt, the use of derivatives to plug holes, and armies of retired public workers who are counting on benefits that are proving harder and harder to pay.

articles.headline: Afghan Leader Is Seen to Flout Influence of U.S.
articles.snippet: The Obama administration is struggling with how to influence an ally they regard as unreliable.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration is struggling with how to influence an ally they regard as unreliable.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — This month, with President Hamid Karzai looking ahead to a visit to the White House, he received a terse note from aides to President Obama: Your invitation has been revoked.
articles.byline: By Dexter Filkins and Mark Landler

articles.headline: The Issue of Liquidity Bubbles Up
articles.snippet: The issue of how much money banks need to keep on hand is bound to be on the regulatory front-burner in the near future.
articles.abstract: The issue of how much money banks need to keep on hand is bound to be on the regulatory front-burner in the near future.
